Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, lazed streaky black below; exterior: maeander pattern running left around rim; below, painted decoration consisting of head (most of beak missing) and neck of goose to left; cross and part pendant corner ornament as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as part of the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl, rather than the painter of the bowl itself, because the sherd displays a greater amount of variety in the filling ornaments, albeit similar to those on the Aphrodite Bowl (Lemos 1991, 74-5).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 38, p. 74, p. 237, no. 168, pl. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0371) (phase 2)
